definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
meandering and circuitous (idiom); complicated developments that never get anywhere/going around in circles
to attack from an unexpected direction

sentences.english: I'm a mini-snake, it snakes within world myself .
sentences.chinese: 我是一条小蛇，在自己的世界里迂回前进。

sentences.english: Others are predators. Deviously setting traps to get what they want.
sentences.chinese: 还有些是猎人，迂回设陷得到她们想要的。

sentences.english: The winding trail caused us to lose our orientation.
sentences.chinese: 迂回曲折的小道使我们迷失了方向。

sentences.english: Longitudinalcheng he solid throughout, folding fighting snake river, tortuous.
sentences.chinese: 固城河纵贯全境，河道斗折蛇行，迂回曲折。

sentences.english: Rather than flashily smash against the wall, why not elegantly turn a corner? Give yourself the space to make a turnaround.
sentences.chinese: 要华丽撞墙不如优雅转身，给自己一个迂回的空间。

sentences.english: The river snakes through the valley .
sentences.chinese: 河流迂回前进通过山谷。
于连提出一种“迂回”的研究策略。

sentences.english: History moves in zigzags and by roundabout ways.
sentences.chinese: 历史的发展是曲折的，迂回的。

sentences.english: The panzers then swung into action, launching an outflanking attack to the south of the town.
sentences.chinese: 装甲部队开始参战，从城市的南面进行迂回攻击。

sentences.english: Many alien plants have become introduced by highly circuitous routes.
sentences.chinese: 许多外来植物是通过极其迂回曲折的道路引进的。

sentences.english: Kish offers us the possibility of a metonymical approach towards the mainland.
sentences.chinese: 基什为我们研究伊朗大陆提供了一种迂回的方式。

sentences.english: Outside the city next to the sea, the mountain road twists and turns and winds around.
sentences.chinese: 在城外紧靠大海的地方，山路迂回曲折，四处延伸。

sentences.english: Bittman took a circuitous path to his job at the Times.
sentences.chinese: 比特曼采取了迂回的路径，他的工作在“纽约时报”。

sentences.english: Sometimes it takes decidedly circuitous routes in planning our demise.
sentences.chinese: 有时候她果断而迂回曲折地筹划对我们的谋杀计划。

sentences.english: This route is indirect to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 这条路迂回地通向海滩。

definition: meandering and circuitous (idiom); complicated developments that never get anywhere/going around in circles
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
depth (from front to rear)/depth (into a territory)/span (of time)/(fig.) depth (of deployment, progress, development etc)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to annihilate/to round up and wipe out
